1117344202591834112.text:
I can't help but notice that every man I know who suffered from kidney stones and went to the doctor was listened to and treated seriously. 

But when I did (several times), I was asked to calm down. I was told it was my period and sent home.

Me: Hey, what's the Wifi password?

Barista: You need to buy a drink first.

Me: I'll have a Latte, please.

Barista: £3, please.

Me: There you go, now what's the Wifi password? 

Barista: You need to buy a drink first. No spaces and all lowercase.

1072600503874478080.text: New paper on batching techniques for accumulators. Applications to stateless blockchains (miners only need 2kb digest to store the entire UTXOs) and shorter STARKs/Aurora. I am flabbergasted.

U. Mahadev first finds how to do classical homomorphic encryption on quantum circuits, uses this to generate provably random numbers and then finds an incredibly clever way to verify quantum computations with a classical computer.https://www.quantamagazine.org/graduate-student-solves-quantum-verification-problem-20181008/ …

1051575252319395841.text: New paper. ZEXE: Zero-knowledge Execution.Think of it like a private OS for the blockchain. Can build private tokens, smart contracts, and maybe even a DEX. Joint work with @matthew_d_green @ebfull @1HowardWu @zkproofs  and Alessandro Chiesa  https://eprint.iacr.org/2018/962.pdf

1051605369884008448.text: Exciting new work: ZEXE enables truly decentralized, privacy-preserving computations using zkSNARKs! Zero-knowledge executions take less than 2 mins to prove and under 100ms to verify. We're on the cusp of private tokens, private smart contracts, private DEXs, and more!https://twitter.com/IACR_News/status/1051468185680183298 …

1048455568468467712.text: "There are 60 million UTXOs; providing merkle tree inclusion proofs that they exist requires 160GB of data. 1040927735399505921.text:
Suppose Jane had $100k in crypto in 2017, traded it to $500k, bought alts at the peak & now they’re worth $50k.
How much does she have?

Actually, negative $62k.

Her crypto is $50k but she owes $112k in short term capital gains tax.

IRS doesn’t care if you still have it.

1003016227000705024.text:
realizing recently (via convos with friends) that, afaik, the ideal env for digital asset ownership doesn't exist yet; we need scalable and user-friendly privacy guarantees by default.

Without that default privacy, real behavior won't ever make its way onto a blockchain.
